intro: Sphenodesme paniculata, commonly known as the clustered panicled spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, branched cluster of small yellow flowers, which are surrounded by specialized bracts. Sphenodesme paniculata is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
